From Gaza to USA: How Twitter trolls were manufacturing consent and dissent
description: The chaos began with a small icon Musk probably assumed would be a cute transparency feature. Instead, it detonated the timeline. For years, people fought with strangers online under the illusion that these strangers lived nearby. That illusion collapsed the moment the map pin dropped. Suddenly, timelines were littered with patriots tweeting from Ankara, Gaza reporters posting from Krakow, and Ivanka Trump megafans tapping away from a quiet suburb in Lagos.

BLO deaths: EC moves fast after audio surfaces of official; TMC sharpens attack
description: The Election Commission is addressing work-related stress among Booth Level Officers (BLOs) during Kerala's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls after an audio message went viral. This follows reports of BLO suicides and deaths due to excessive pressure in several states, prompting protests and criticism from political parties regarding the rushed and opaque nature of the revision process.

title: SC accepts Rs 5,100 crore settlement offer  by Sterling Biotech in bank fraud case
‘Every home had a favourite Dharmendra film’: Virat Kohli, Yuvraj Singh, Harbhajan Singh and other cricketers pay tribute to veteran actor after his passing
Electronics firm, NGO: How fake firms helped cyber fraud syndicate siphon Rs 2.7 crore
When Hema Malini shared her love story with Dharmendra: ‘He was a very good-looking, straight forward, simple man’
Dharmendra passes away at 89: Singer Kamal Khan condoles
description: Legendary Bollywood actor Dharmendra passed away at 89 in Mumbai. Singer Kamal Khan paid tribute, calling him an inspiration whose journey from Punjab to cinema and connection to his roots touched souls. Dharmendra's demise marks the end of an era for fans and the industry.

title: Virat Kohli mourns Dharmendra: 'Today, we have lost a legend'
description: Indian cricket stars, including Virat Kohli, Deepti Sharma, Virender Sehwag, Harbhajan Singh, Kedar Jadhav, and Shikhar Dhawan, have paid heartfelt tributes to legendary Bollywood actor Dharmendra, who passed away at 89. IPL teams also joined in mourning the iconic actor, remembering his charm, talent, and enduring legacy in Indian cinema.

title: In bid to check spas offering unauthorised procedures, Karnataka govt makes registration with health dept mandatory
Why do pigeons have a good sense of direction?
Africa, climate, debt sustainability, UNSC reform: 10 key takeaways from the G20 leaders’ declaration
As new labour codes spark a row, a look at rise and fall of trade unions in India
Siraj’s spidercam prank! Camera operator's response steals the show — Watch
description: Mohammed Siraj's lighthearted moment with the Spidercam offered a brief respite for Indian fans amidst a tough day 3 in Guwahati. South Africa dominated, with Marco Jansen's exceptional all-round performance, including 6/48, crippling India's first innings and bundling them out for 201. The Proteas did not enforce the follow-on and opted to bat again.

title: Can India’s new labour codes finally bridge the gender divide at work?
description: India’s new Labour Codes, enforced from 21 November 2025, attempt to bridge the long-standing gap between rhetoric and reality on women’s workforce participation. By mandating wage equality, enabling night-shift work with safeguards, formalising employment, expanding social security, and recognising gig workers, the Codes mark a structural shift toward safer, fairer and more equitable workplaces for women.

title: IAS Officer Tina Dabi wins award for water harvesting in Barmer; know her UPSC CSE journey
Here’s why Kerala High Court upheld acquittal of rape accused father
‘Blot on nation’s conscience’: Calcutta High Court orders Rs 30 lakh award for sewer workers’ deaths, injuries, orders probe
Phansi Ghar row: Will Kejriwal appear before Delhi Assembly Committee? No interim order in his favour, says High Court

UP youth arrested for ‘kidnapping’ minor girl from another community found dead in pond
Study Abroad Report: Not engineering, these are the safest degrees
Vanes Martirosyan: American boxer dies at 39 after two-year cancer battle
description: Former U.S. Olympic boxer Vanes Martirosyan has passed away at 39 after a two-year fight with cancer. The world title contender, who represented the U.S. at the 2004 Olympics, was diagnosed with skin cancer in 2023. His family confirmed the heartbreaking news, remembering him as a loving husband, father, and kind soul.

title: India hit the Jansen wall again; South Africa closes in on historic series victory
description: India's batting collapsed spectacularly on day three in Guwahati, succumbing to poor decisions and shot selection against South Africa. Despite a pitch described as a 'road', India was bowled out for 201, with Marco Jansen claiming six wickets. South Africa, leading by 314 runs, is poised for a series victory, leaving India hoping for a miracle.

title: Stuart Broad on his viral moment in the commentary box in the 1st Ashes Test: ‘Close my eyes and just pray that it wasn’t actually happening’
Sunny Deol looked ‘hurt’ whenever Dharmendra poured himself alcohol, made him feel ‘guilty’ for drinking: ‘He learnt from my mistakes’
How Delhi’s air quality monitors work — and why their readings can falter
Feel Low in Winter? Discover the Causes and Symptoms of Seasonal Affective Disorder
description: As winter's shorter days and longer nights arrive, many experience a dip in mood and energy, potentially indicating winter depression, a form of SAD. This condition, linked to light exposure and disrupted circadian rhythms, can be managed with strategies like maximizing sunlight, maintaining routines, and a balanced diet.

title: 'Masks off, real faces out': BJP flays Cong; Hidma posters at pollution stir sparks row
description: BJP leader Sudhanshu Trivedi criticized protesters at India Gate for raising slogans supporting a slain Naxal commander, accusing them of being influenced by "pollution of Marx and Mao." The protest, initially against air pollution, saw demonstrators holding posters of Madvi Hidma, leading to arrests by Delhi Police for obstructing personnel and assaulting them.

title: Why UP sugarcane fields are now reaping ground for rising man-animal conflicts
Wedding postponed: Smriti removes marriage posts; father, fiancé hospitalised
description: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana has removed all wedding-related posts from her Instagram. This comes as her father, Shrinivas Mandhana, was hospitalised. The wedding ceremony, scheduled for November 23, has been indefinitely postponed. Her manager confirmed the postponement due to Mr Mandhana's health. The couple and families request privacy during this time.

title: Not just play: Why Physical Education may be the smartest learning hour in school
description: A new meta-analysis finds that turning school Physical Education from lonely laps into structured, team-based activities can sharply improve children’s thinking skills, social confidence, physical competence and emotional resilience. With shared goals, clear roles and quick reflection built into games, the PE period becomes a powerful lab for better classroom learning, focus and engagement for children in today’s schools everywhere.

title: Amit Shah’s deadline to end Naxalism looming, Maoists make a request: Give time till Feb 15

SIR form submitted — will you be called for a hearing in West Bengal? Here’s what you need to know
School teachers to be mentored by professors: Here’s all about India's NMM initiative
description: The UGC has issued a new advisory asking universities to nominate senior faculty for the National Mission for Mentoring, a programme designed to link experienced academics with schoolteachers. The move aligns with NEP 2020’s plan to build a national mentoring system. Selected professors will guide teachers in pedagogy, digital literacy, foundational learning and other key areas through the NMM portal.

title: This is what happens to the body when you eat clean and finish dinner by 7 pm for a month
Focussed on sub-conventional operations, Mitra Shakti military exercise between India and Sri Lanka concludes
Questions arise as Punjab crosses paddy procurement target despite lowest yield in a decade
'Why? Why? Why?': Angry Mamata shoots off letter to EC; flags 'disturbing' decisions
description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has expressed alarm to the Election Commission over two "disturbing" developments concerning the state's election machinery. She questioned the outsourcing of data entry work by the Chief Electoral Officer and the proposal to set up polling booths in private housing complexes, citing concerns about fairness and potential political influence.

title: IIT Delhi launches 6-month online executive programme in Brand Management
Farewell to Bollywood's 'He-Man': Esha Deol breaks down; Big B, Salman attend last rites
description: Bollywood icon Dharmendra passed away at his Mumbai residence on November 24. The legendary actor's cremation was conducted swiftly, with many industry colleagues and family members, including Hema Malini and the Deol family, in attendance to pay their final respects. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu mourned his passing, acknowledging his significant contributions to Indian cinema.

Telangana High Court directs Centre to ‘expedite process’ concerning man detained in Hyderabad with Indian passport and Bangladeshi ID
Apple's warning to stores: Foreign SIM = penalty; outlets face closure risk
description: Apple distributors are warning Indian retailers against activating new iPhones, especially the iPhone 17 series, with foreign SIMs within 90 days, citing hefty penalties and store code blocking. This crackdown follows a surge in iPhone 17 models being diverted to high-margin markets like Russia, Africa, and the Middle East, causing domestic shortages. Retailers are pushing back against this mandate, arguing it unfairly targets them.

Hungary foreign minister says Europe should support the 28-point peace plan
‘AI-generated images causing fear’: Search continues after leopard sighting in Aundh, officials say no further activity detected
Dharmendra no more: Hindi cinema loses a legend; nation remembers his golden era
description: Veteran actor Dharmendra, Bollywood's 'He-Man', passed away in Mumbai at 89 after a brief illness. Renowned for a prolific career spanning six decades and over 300 films, including the iconic 'Sholay', the legendary actor leaves an indelible mark on Indian cinema. His final film, 'Ikkis', is slated for release next year. Dharmendra's legacy is celebrated for his versatility and charm.

Sachchidanand Sinha’s death has snapped the last living link of the Lohia stream of socialism
Pepper spray, Hidma posters and broken barricades: Protest over Delhi pollution stuns cops
description: A clean-air protest at Delhi's India Gate took a surprising turn as demonstrators displayed posters of slain Maoist commander Madvi Hidma. Police arrested 22 individuals for refusing to disperse, using chilli spray on officers, and blocking traffic. The incident occurred amidst severe air pollution levels plaguing the national capital.

title: Ranbir Kapoor slammed for ‘fake’ vegetarian claims for Ramayana as Netflix clip shows Kapoors feasting on mutton: what’s the truth?
Sikh scholar says Dec 10, Human Rights Day, should be dedicated to Guru Tegh Bahadur on his 350th martyrdom anniversary; here’s why
'Does a lot of dishes': Usha Vance reacts to missing ring
description: Second Lady Usha Vance clarified speculation surrounding her marriage after being photographed without her wedding ring. A spokesperson attributed the oversight to her busy role as a mother of three, emphasizing no deeper meaning. This follows recent online scrutiny of Vice President JD Vance's interactions at a conservative event and his comments regarding his wife's religious beliefs.

title: Tom Brady’s on-air slip? Viral Cowboys-Eagles clip triggers debate online
description: Tom Brady stumbled over a player's name during a live broadcast of the Dallas Cowboys versus Philadelphia Eagles game. The incident occurred in the final minutes of the match. Social media users reacted to the verbal mix-up. Brady is in his second season as a commentator for FOX. The game itself saw Dallas achieve a historic comeback victory.

title: ‘Engraved with initials’: Titanic passenger's gold pocket watch sold for 1.78m pounds
description: A gold pocket watch belonging to Titanic victim Isidor Straus, Macy's co-owner, fetched a record 1.78 million pounds at auction. The 18-karat timepiece, which stopped at the moment the ship sank, was gifted to him in 1888.

title: Areas close to waste-to-energy plants have Delhi’s worst air; Okhla, Ghazipur worst hit
description: Residents near Delhi's waste-to-energy plants endure severe pollution, with foul air and acrid odors plaguing their neighborhoods year-round. Despite burning thousands of tons of waste daily and emitting toxic pollutants, these plants are excluded from emergency pollution control measures like GRAP, leaving communities vulnerable to chronic and seasonal health impacts.

title: Stefon Diggs’ partner Cardi B makes gold pendant from baby’s umbilical cord
description: Cardi B commemorated her fourth child's birth by transforming her umbilical cord into a gold pendant and her placenta into vitamins. This unique practice, offered by Mommy Made Encapsulation, also includes creating a "Tree of Life" placenta print. The service aims to preserve the initial bond between parent and child, a trend embraced by other celebrities.

title: OpenAI's internal memo: Altman notes Google’s AI success; calls it 'temporary headwind'
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledges Google's AI advancements, noting potential "temporary economic headwinds" but expressing confidence in OpenAI's rapid progress and leadership in the AI race. Despite concerns about slowing ChatGPT engagement, Altman urged employees to focus on achieving superintelligence, highlighting the company's strength and unique challenges.
